definition: sophist/one who relies on specious arguments

sentences.english: Sophistry is a kind of special negative thought.
sentences.chinese: 诡辩是一种特殊的负面思维形式。

sentences.english: Liang Ke Shuo" of Dengxi used to be regarded as a sophism."
sentences.chinese: 邓析的“两可说”历来被视为是诡辩。

sentences.english: He would like to dream the same by nature to develop into equivalence is the sophistry of the.
sentences.chinese: 他把想与梦的同生性，发展成为等同性就是诡辩了。

sentences.english: He that speaketh sophistically, is hateful: he shall be destitute of every thing.
sentences.chinese: 有的人诡辩，出言可恶，他必将缺乏各种食物。

sentences.english: Do not listen to this sophistry by vested interests.
sentences.chinese: 不要听信这些既得利益者的诡辩。

sentences.english: Purple is the color of royalty and sophistication showing wealth and luxury.
sentences.chinese: 紫色是一种显示财富和奢侈的象征王权和诡辩的颜色。

sentences.english: So it went with the Sophists.
sentences.chinese: 所以，诡辩家们就遭到了这样的命运。

sentences.english: Dialectical analyzing the nature of sophism, it is a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 从辩证法上来分析，诡辩的本质是一种谬误。

sentences.english: This sophism goes against common sense.
sentences.chinese: 其实这是违反常识的诡辩。

sentences.english: Have done with your foolish sophism.
For it can contain nothing but sophistry and illusion.
sentences.chinese: 那就将它付之一炬，因为它含有的不过是诡辩和幻想。

sentences.english: Asking questions was at the heart of the Sophist approach to learning.
sentences.chinese: “质疑”是诡辩家学习的一大制胜法宝。

sentences.english: What you are really doing is quibbling .
Also a voice sophistry to say that is not right, coal, and is blue.
sentences.chinese: 又一个声音诡辩地说，都不对，煤，是蓝色的。

sentences.english: I felt no need for these sophistries.
sentences.chinese: 我感到我的诡辩毫无必要了。

definition: to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
lit. to have a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. to have a glib tongue
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
reductio ad absurdum/arguing by contradiction/also called 反證法|反证法
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
sophist/one who relies on specious arguments
